verses.verse: Hear <S%H8085><s%> this <S%H3548><s%>, O ye priests, and hearken <S%H7181><s%>, O house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and give ear <S%H238><s%>, O house <S%H1004><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%>; for unto you pertaineth the judgment <S%H4941><s%>; for ye have been a snare <S%H6341><s%> at Mizpah <S%H4709><s%>, and a net <S%H7568><s%> spread <S%H6566><s%> upon Tabor <S%H8396><s%>.
And the revolters <S%H7846><s%> are gone deep <S%H6009><s%> in making slaughter <S%H7819><s%>; but I am a rebuker of them all <S%H4148><s%>.

I know <S%H3045><s%> Ephraim <S%H669><s%>, and Israel <S%H3478><s%> is not hid <S%H3582><s%> from me <S%H669><s%>; for now, O Ephraim, thou hast played the harlot <S%H2181><s%>, Israel <S%H3478><s%> is defiled <S%H2930><s%>.

Their doings <S%H4611><s%> will not suffer <S%H5414><s%> them to turn <S%H7725><s%> unto their God <S%H430><s%>; for the spirit <S%H7307><s%> of whoredom <S%H2183><s%> is within <S%H7130><s%> them <S%H3045><s%>, and they know not Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.

And the pride <S%H1347><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> doth testify <S%H6030><s%> to his face <S%H6440><s%>: therefore Israel <S%H3478><s%> and Ephraim <S%H669><s%> shall stumble <S%H3782><s%> in their iniquity <S%H5771><s%>; Judah <S%H3063><s%> also shall stumble with them <S%H3782><s%>.

They shall go <S%H3212><s%> with their flocks <S%H6629><s%> and with their herds <S%H1241><s%> to seek <S%H1245><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>; but they shall not find <S%H4672><s%> him <S%H2502><s%>: he hath withdrawn himself from them.

They have dealt treacherously <S%H898><s%> against Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>; for they have borne <S%H3205><s%> strange <S%H2114><s%> children <S%H1121><s%>: now shall the new moon <S%H2320><s%> devour <S%H398><s%> them with their fields <S%H2506><s%>.

Blow <S%H8628><s%> ye the cornet <S%H7782><s%> in Gibeah <S%H1390><s%>, and the trumpet <S%H2689><s%> in Ramah <S%H7414><s%>: sound an alarm <S%H7321><s%> at Beth-aven <S%H1007><s%>; behind <S%H310><s%> thee <S%H1144><s%>, O Benjamin.

Ephraim <S%H669><s%> shall become a desolation <S%H8047><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of rebuke <S%H8433><s%>: among the tribes <S%H7626><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> have I made known <S%H3045><s%> that which shall surely be <S%H539><s%>.

The princes <S%H8269><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> are like them that remove <S%H5253><s%> the landmark <S%H1366><s%>: I will pour out <S%H8210><s%> my wrath <S%H5678><s%> upon them like water <S%H4325><s%>.

Ephraim <S%H669><s%> is oppressed <S%H6231><s%>, he is crushed <S%H7533><s%> in judgment <S%H4941><s%>; because he was content <S%H2974><s%> to walk <S%H1980><s%> after <S%H310><s%> man <S%H6673><s%>'s command.
Therefore am I unto Ephraim <S%H669><s%> as a moth <S%H6211><s%>, and to the house <S%H1004><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> as rottenness <S%H7538><s%>.

When Ephraim <S%H669><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> his sickness <S%H2483><s%>, and Judah <S%H3063><s%> saw his wound <S%H4205><s%>, then went <S%H3212><s%> Ephraim <S%H669><s%> to Assyria <S%H804><s%>, and sent <S%H7971><s%> to king <S%H4428><s%> Jareb <S%H3377><s%>: but he is not able <S%H3201><s%> to heal <S%H7495><s%> you <S%H1455><s%>, neither will he cure you of your wound <S%H4205><s%>.

For I will be unto Ephraim <S%H669><s%> as a lion <S%H7826><s%>, and as a young lion <S%H3715><s%> to the house <S%H1004><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>: I <S%H2963><s%>, even I, will tear and go away <S%H3212><s%>; I will carry off <S%H5375><s%>, and there shall be none to deliver <S%H5337><s%>.

I will go <S%H3212><s%> and return <S%H7725><s%> to my place <S%H4725><s%>, till they acknowledge their offence <S%H816><s%>, and seek <S%H1245><s%> my face <S%H6440><s%>: in their affliction <S%H6862><s%> they will seek me earnestly <S%H7836><s%>.
